awd_titl_txt: Conference: New Frontiers in Reliability and Risk Analysis
awd_abstract_narration:
A group of multidisciplinary researchers from the George Washington University, Georgetown University, North Carolina State University, Trinity College, and City University of Hong Kong have developed a two-day conference in New Frontiers in Reliability and Risk Analysis to be held at the Science and Engineering Hall of the George Washington University on October 13-14, 2023. The conference will focus on modern statistical methodologies of Reliability and Risk Analysis, which have a broad appeal, with applications in a vast array of disciplines such as engineering, science, business, medicine, law, healthcare and the social sciences. The conference organizers encourage participation and attendance by early-career researchers with diverse backgrounds and researchers from underrepresented groups.

The conference will be emphasizing presentation of topics on novel application areas and modern theoretical developments such as Adversarial Risk Analysis, Fusion Learning in Survival Analysis, Big Data in Reliability, Financial Risk Analytics, Machine Learning in Risk Analysis, and Deep and Reinforcement Learning in Reliability and Risk Analysis, Block Chains and Reliability, and Bayesian Learning and Decision Making with Big Data. The conference will feature key plenary speakers. For more specific and up to date conference details, interested parties are referred to the conference website: statistics.columbian.gwu.edu/nds2023.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
A two-day conference was held at the George Washington University on October 13 - 14, 2023. The conference was meant to honor the work of Nozer D. Singpurwalla, his contributions in the fields of reliability, risk analysis, and Bayesian Statistics, and at the same time, to discuss current and emerging trends in these fields.

The conference was successful in attracting the top names in the fields of reliability, risk analysis, Bayesian statistics, and AI and machine learning and bringing them together with aspiring young researchers. The conference was well attended with over 70 participants coming from 25 different academic institutions and 7 research and industrial organizations from the US as well as from India, Ireland, Italy and Nepal. More than 50% of the participants were junior researchers and doctoral students and about 30% were from underrepresented groups.

The conference featured 2 plenary talks, 3 invited paper sessions, 4 contributed paper sessions, a poster session and a dinner talk. Funding was provided 29 people including 18 travel awards and 11 partial awards. Majority of the recipients (90%) were junior researchers and doctoral students and about 45% were from underrepresented groups. In addition, 15 invited speakers and 8 invited participants were funded using other sources.

More information about the conference including the detailed program and book of abstracts can be obtained from the conference website: New Frontiers in Reliability and Risk Analysis: A Tribute to Nozer D. Singpurwalla | Department of Statistics | Columbian College of Arts & Sciences | The George Washington University

A special issue of the journal, Applied Stochastic Processes Models in Business and Industry is dedicated to the New Frontiers in Reliability and Risk Analysis, theme of the conference. The special issue is scheduled for early spring 2025. About 50% of the papers in the special issue are by the conference speakers and participants. More information on the special issue can be obtained from the website: Special Issue on New Frontiers in Reliability and Risk Analysis: A Tribute to Nozer D. Singpurwalla

 

 

 

 

 


Last Modified: 01/22/2025
Modified by: Refik Soyer
